title: The Hundred Draft – the full squads: Smith and Warner signed, Gayle and Malinga snubbed
text:
The Hundred Draft took place on Sunday evening (Picture: Getty)

Chris Gayle and Lasith Malinga failed to secure contracts at The Hundred Draft as Steve Smith and David Warner landed lucrative deals for next summer’s competition.

West Indies hero Gayle and Sri Lanka legend Malinga will not feature in the inaugural running of The Hundred after their £125,000 valuations failed to attract interest.

England’s Liam Livingstone and South African leg-spinner Imran Tahir were both surprise signings at the top price bracket. Australia stars Smith, Warner, Glenn Maxwell and Aaron Finch were also bought for £125,000.

Afghanistan superstar Rashid Khan was the first pick of the evening and West Indies duo Andre Russell and Sunil Narine also proved popular in the first round of the draft.
